data.title: Restaurant order
data.statement:
Bob is hungry and goes into a restaurant to eat.

Bob has a [[budget]].
The restaurant has [[nbAppetizers]] appetizers, [[nbMainCourses]] main courses and [[nbDesserts]] desserts.

Bob wants the most expensive complete menu that he can buy.

Output Bob's remaining money after buying the complete menu.
If Bob doesn't have enough budget for any complete menu, output {{HUNGRY}}.

Note: A complete menu is composed by 1 appetizer, 1 main course and 1 dessert.

testCases.title: Test 3
testCases.testIn:
25
2 2 2
mimosa egg,5
salad,4
quiche lorraine,8
raclette,12
profiterole,9
clafoutis,7

data.constraints:
0 ≤ [[budget]] ≤ 100
1 ≤ [[nbAppetizers]] ≤ 4
1 ≤ [[nbMainCourses]] ≤ 4
1 ≤ [[nbDesserts]] ≤ 4
3 ≤ [[nbAppetizers]]+[[nbMainCourses]]+[[nbDesserts]] ≤ 6
1 ≤ length of [[appetizer]] ≤ 30
1 ≤ length of [[mainCourse]] ≤ 30
1 ≤ length of [[dessert]] ≤ 30
1 ≤ [[price]] ≤ 50
data.stubGenerator:
read budget:int
read nbAppetizers:int nbMainCourses:int nbDesserts:int
loop nbAppetizers read line:string(50)
loop nbMainCourses read line:string(50)
loop nbDesserts read line:string(50)
write HUNGRY
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> an integer [[budget]], corresponding to Bob's budget for his lunch.
<<Line 2 :>> three integers separated by space, [[nbAppetizers]], [[nbMainCourses]] and [[nbDesserts]], respectively corresponding to the number of appetizers, the number of main courses and the number of desserts.
<<Next [[nbAppetizers]] lines :>> a string [[appetizer]] and an integer [[price]], separated by a comma (,).
<<Next [[nbMainCourses]] lines :>> a string [[mainCourse]] and an integer [[price]], separated by a comma (,).
<<Next [[nbDesserts]] lines :>> a string [[dessert]] and an integer [[price]], separated by a comma (,).
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> The remaining budget of Bob, after he bought the most expensive complete menu that he can. Or {{HUNGRY}}, if he can't buy any complete menu.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Bob is hungry and goes into a restaurant to eat.

Bob has a budget.
The restaurant has nbAppetizers appetizers, nbMainCourses main courses and nbDesserts desserts.

Bob wants the most expensive complete menu that he can buy.

Output Bob's remaining money after buying the complete menu.
If Bob doesn't have enough budget for any complete menu, output HUNGRY.

Note: A complete menu is composed by 1 appetizer, 1 main course and 1 dessert.
Input
Line 1 : an integer budget, corresponding to Bob's budget for his lunch.
Line 2 : three integers separated by space, nbAppetizers, nbMainCourses and nbDesserts, respectively corresponding to the number of appetizers, the number of main courses and the number of desserts.
Next nbAppetizers lines : a string appetizer and an integer price, separated by a comma (,).
Next nbMainCourses lines : a string mainCourse and an integer price, separated by a comma (,).
Next nbDesserts lines : a string dessert and an integer price, separated by a comma (,).
Output
Line 1 : The remaining budget of Bob, after he bought the most expensive complete menu that he can. Or HUNGRY, if he can't buy any complete menu.
Constraints
0 ≤ budget ≤ 100
1 ≤ nbAppetizers ≤ 4
1 ≤ nbMainCourses ≤ 4
1 ≤ nbDesserts ≤ 4
3 ≤ nbAppetizers+nbMainCourses+nbDesserts ≤ 6
1 ≤ length of appetizer ≤ 30
1 ≤ length of mainCourse ≤ 30
1 ≤ length of dessert ≤ 30
1 ≤ price ≤ 50
Example
Input
30
1 1 1
mimosa egg,5
breton pancake,15
paris-brest,8
Output
2
